title: Daaku Maharaaj needs THIS much to break even in Nizam - 123telugu
summary:
Daaku Maharaaj Needs ₹20 Crore to Break Even in Nizam

Published on Jan 8, 2025 by 123telugu

Daaku Maharaaj is Balakrishna’s upcoming film, set to hit screens on January 12, 2025. Bobby directs this action drama, produced by Naga Vamsi.

  • To break even in the Nizam area, the film needs to earn a share of ₹20 crore.
  • The film's success heavily relies on positive word-of-mouth from its initial reviews.
  • It faces competition from Game Changer and Sankranthiki Vasthunnam, releasing around the same time.
  • Producers are confident in the film's success, which is why ticket prices in the Nizam region have not been raised.

Interestingly, this film's reception will determine its financial success, considering the stable ticket pricing.

title: Kangana Ranaut recalls challenges she faced while making Emergency, film being scrutinised: Will it ever get released? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kangana Ranaut Discusses Her Challenges in Making 'Emergency'

Date: Jan 08, 2025

Source: HT Entertainment Desk

Kangana Ranaut shares her experiences and challenges in bringing her upcoming film 'Emergency' to the audience, highlighting struggles with funding and censor scrutiny.

  • Kangana faced numerous difficulties during the production of 'Emergency', including conflicts and funding issues.
  • She sold her property in Mumbai due to delays and uncertainty about the film's release.
  • The film, focused on the Emergency period imposed by Indira Gandhi, initially missed its release date due to certification issues.
  • 'Emergency' is set to finally release on January 17 with approval from the Central Board of Film Certification.
"Bhaut sangharsh raha...kaafi cheezo ka saamana karna pada (There were a lot of conflicts... we faced a lot of challenges)." - Kangana Ranaut

The journey to release 'Emergency' has been fraught with challenges, but Kangana remains optimistic and excited to share the film with the world.
newTitle: Kangana Ranaut Discusses Her Challenges in Making 'Emergency'

After turning director with Kalyan Ram’s Devil last year, popular Tollywood producer Abhishek Nama is ready with his second directorial project, Nagabandham: The Secret Treasure. The film is touted as an adventurous mythological drama inspired by the discoveries of hidden treasures at the Padmanabhaswamy and Puri Jagannath Temples, and it will have a pan-Indian release this summer.

  • Unveiling of a striking pre-look poster that raises curiosity.
  • The protagonist faces a massive, slightly ajar ancient temple door emitting bright light.
  • Nagabandham delves into the mystery surrounding the 108 Vishnu temples in India.
  • The main lead is played by young hero Virat Karrna, with Nabha Natesh and Iswarya Menon as female leads.
  • The film’s shoot is currently underway in Hyderabad, with the first look poster set to be unveiled on January 13.

title: Marco star Unni Mukundan says film won't influence people to go on a ‘killing spree’: ‘Nothing happened after KGF’ - Hindustan Times
summary:

The new Malayalam film 'Marco', featuring Unni Mukundan as a vengeful gangster, has attracted critical attention for its portrayal of violence. In a recent interview, Mukundan emphasized that the film does not aim to influence violent behavior in audiences.

  • The film presents a raw portrayal of violence in a narrative about vengeance.
  • Unni Mukundan argues that audiences understand it's just a film meant for entertainment.
  • He cited 'KGF' as a successful film but questioned its societal influence, noting that nothing significant happened in its aftermath.
  • 'Marco' has been a box office success since its release on December 20, 2024.
“I have been told that people had a tough time watching it but that was it. That was the whole idea of giving a certain kind of experience.” - Unni Mukundan

The film aims to push the boundaries of violence in cinema while emphasizing that it should be viewed as a work of fiction.
